data.title: Airports and airlines
data.meta_description: Airports and airlines in Scotland Major airports Scotland is served by three major airports in Glasgow, Edinburgh and Aberdeen, with smaller airports located around the country.   Glasgow Airport The airport is served by local bus services, including the Glasgow Airport Express between the airport and city centre.
data.text:
Airports and airlines in Scotland

Major airports

Scotland is served by three major airports in Glasgow, Edinburgh and Aberdeen, with smaller airports located around the country.

Glasgow Airport

The airport is served by local bus services, including the Glasgow Airport Express between the airport and city centre.

For details of routes to other destinations, and information on all modes of travel (including rail connections), please visit the airport website.

glasgowairport.com

0844 481 5555

Edinburgh Airport

Edinburgh Airport is connected to the city centre by frequent Edinburgh Tram and Airlink, Bright Bus Airport Express and Skylink bus services.

For details of routes to other destinations, and information on all modes of travel (including rail connections), please visit the airport website.

edinburghairport.com

0844 448 8833

Aberdeen Airport

Regular buses run between Aberdeen Airport and the city centre. The airport's bus services page provides more information on routes.

For details on other modes of travel (including rail connections), please visit the airport website.

aberdeenairport.com

0844 481 6666
